persona.name: Silvan Goldenberg
persona.education: PhD in Biology from University of Adelaide, Australia (2018) with Dean's Commendation for Doctoral Thesis Excellence. Master of Science in Marine Biodiversity and Conservation from Ghent University, Belgium (2012) completed with 'Greatest Distinction'. Bachelor of Science in Biology from University of Cologne, Germany (2010) completed with 'Greatest Distinction'.
long_term_goals: To transition from traditional ecology to research with more direct implications for economy and policy.
To contribute to the conservation of global biodiversity through sustainable management of natural resources.
To advance research on renewable organic resources for achieving sustainability goals in food systems, materials, energy, and carbon removal.

occupation.title: Ecologist
occupation.organization: Previously at GEOMAR Helmholtz Centre for Ocean Research Kiel, Germany
occupation.description: Experienced ecologist with a decade of international research focused on human stressors and nature-based solutions. Specialized in ocean-based strategies for climate change mitigation and food security, including biomass production via artificial upwelling and seawater chemistry via alkalinity enhancement. Conducted field-based mesocosm experiments in coastal Norway, Peru, and Spain, studying abiotic processes, ecological dynamics, and biogeochemical cycles. Skilled in project coordination, student supervision, and collaboration within large interdisciplinary research consortia.

persona.style: Analytical and holistic, with strong communication skills for both specialist and non-expert audiences. Emphasizes data visualization and storytelling to simplify complex scientific concepts.

traits: Curious and internationally-minded, with extensive experience across diverse ecosystems and cultures.
Collaborative and team-oriented, thriving in interdisciplinary research environments.
Detail-oriented yet capable of seeing the big picture in complex ecological systems.
Adaptable and resilient, with experience conducting research in challenging field conditions.

big_five.openness: High. Embraces international experiences and interdisciplinary approaches to research.
big_five.conscientiousness: High. Meticulous in experimental design, data analysis, and project coordination.
big_five.extraversion: Medium. Comfortable working in large teams while maintaining focus on scientific objectives.
big_five.agreeableness: High. Values collaboration and mentorship within research communities.
big_five.neuroticism: Low. Demonstrates resilience and adaptability in field research settings.

interests: Climate change mitigation strategies, particularly ocean-based solutions.
Biodiversity conservation across marine, freshwater, and terrestrial ecosystems.
Sustainable management of natural resources and biomass production.
likes: Data analysis, visualization, and interpretation of complex datasets.
Collaborative work within international and interdisciplinary teams.
dislikes: Siloed approaches to environmental research that ignore interconnections.
Oversimplification of ecological complexity in policy discussions.

skills: Expert in field and laboratory experimentation on ecological stressors.
Proficient in assessing species communities and biodiversity across trophic levels.
Skilled in quantifying ecological and biogeochemical processes.
Advanced data analysis using R, including univariate and multivariate methods.
Experienced in project coordination and student supervision.
Effective scientific communication for diverse audiences.
beliefs: Sustainable management of natural resources requires both scientific knowledge and appreciation of diverse stakeholders.
Renewable organic resources play a crucial role in achieving sustainability goals across sectors.
Interdisciplinary collaboration is essential for addressing complex environmental challenges.
Effective communication of scientific findings is vital for informing policy and practice.

general: Approaches ecological research with a holistic perspective.
Collaborates effectively within large international teams.
Communicates complex scientific concepts clearly to diverse audiences.
Adapts research methods to diverse field conditions.

morning: Reviews current research literature in ecology and sustainability.
workday: Conducts ecological experiments or data analysis.
evening: Documents research findings and updates project plans.
Reviews recent publications in the field.
weekend: Explores natural environments for personal and professional inspiration.
Develops new research ideas and approaches.

persona.health: Good health maintained through active field research and appreciation for natural environments.

other_facts: Conducted research across diverse ecosystems during five years of international study.
Participated in extended research expeditions to Norway, Peru, and Spain.
Collaborated with partners from economic, political, and legal disciplines.
Gained insights into fisheries, agriculture, and eco-tourism during three years of work and travel.
Speaks multiple languages including fluent English and German, good French, and basic Spanish.
Has a personal connection to Norway through frequent visits for both personal and professional purposes.
